benchmark_details.name: ESSAY JUDGE
benchmark_details.overview: ESSAY JUDGE is the first multimodal benchmark for assessing the automated essay scoring (AES) capabilities of multimodal large language models (MLLMs) across lexical-, sentence-, and discourse-level traits.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the AES capabilities of multimodal large language models (MLLMs) across lexical, sentence, and discourse-level traits.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset primarily consists of essays written by non-native speakers of English, which may not fully represent native speakers' essays.

data.source: K-12 Education Organization providing a repository of graded essays by experienced educators.
data.annotation: Multi-round human annotation and verification by educators and linguistic experts.

methodology.calculation: QWK measures the agreement between model scores and the ground truth.
methodology.interpretation: Scores closer to 1 indicate better agreement with human evaluations.
methodology.baseline_results: QWK scores reveal gaps in AES performance compared to human evaluators.
methodology.validation: Comparative evaluation involving multiple MLLMs and human evaluators.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The dataset includes work from non-native English speakers, which may introduce bias in scoring.
